H0.text: What links Cartagena, Maracaibo and Barranquilla. They are major cities in South America

H1.text: What links Cartagena, Maracaibo and Barranquilla. They are located near the Caribbean Sea

H2.text: What links Cartagena, Maracaibo and Barranquilla. They have a rich cultural heritage

H3.text: What links Cartagena, Maracaibo and Barranquilla. They are ports

A4.text: Maracaibo is the largest city in Venezuela and the second-largest city proper in Venezuela, after the national capital, Caracas.

A5.text: Maracaibo has one of the countryâ€™s largest seaports, serving as a key export terminal for crude oil and general cargo.

A6.text: Barranquilla serves as a port for river and maritime transportation within Colombia.

A7.text: The Carnival of Barranquilla was declared a National Cultural Heritage by the Congress of Colombia in 2001 and recognized by UNESCO in 2003.
